result.execSummary:
The defendant Philip L. Tabili Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for 63 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Victims, unless otherwise permitted by the agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Deft accepted into the Drug Court Program.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  May not have contact with Jerrel Grover or his residence, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.  
DPA Hearing on 10-27-17 @ 8:30 am.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge - Ct 1
Drug Court Porgram Participation Agreement

Defendant Philip L. Tabili appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Defendant in custody.  Attorney Tracey Lynn Braun appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Fowler.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Sentence:
Ct 1:  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 36 months w/conditions.  63 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs ordered.  No restitution requested.  Def. accepted into the Drug Court Program and to report to Drug Court on Weds. at 3:30 pm.  Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hrg set for 8/17/16 at 3:15 pm (for Ct 1 only) before Br 4 Drug Court.  The 9/1/16 STC hrg is canceled.

Atty Watson requests more time to determine if def. is eligible for Drug Court.  Status conf. re Count 1 on 7/14/16 at 9:50 removed from the calendar; rescheduled for 9/1/16 at 1:30.  D.A. and Atty Watson given notice of new date via email.
Revoked - Sentenced to KCJ/HOC
Amended to include the language "CV Judgment entered for unpaid financial obligations".  kmk
Bond amended refund per court order. kk/jg CK# 16CH076382
Cts.2&3  kmk

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/Cynthia D, Jerril G, or their residences.
943.10(1m)(a) -Attempt Burglary of a Building or Dwelling
Counts 2 & 3

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
Parties are here for sentencing in Count 1 and a sentencing after revocation in Counts 2 & 3.  Upon hearing statements Count 1 is set over to allow Atty Watson to look into drug treatment court.  Sentencing arguments are made on Counts 2 & 3.  
Count 2 - DE is sentenced to 9 months in the KCJ forthwith.  Count 3 - DE is sentenced to 90 days in the KCJ forthwith and both Counts 2 & 3 are concurrent.  Credit for 190 days.   ADA Binger requests DE's bond be remanded at this time and Atty Watson has no objection, but requests the $1000 previously posted be returned.  Upon hearing statements court increases DE's bond to a $20,000 Cash Bond and the initial $1000 previously posted is to be returned to the poster at this time.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 09:50 am.
Note:  Counts 2 and 3 - Civil judgment to be entered for unpaid financial obligations.  kz...entered on 6/7/16.
Atty  K Watson.
Sentencing rescheduled to 6/3/16 at 11:00 AM as requested by Atty Watson and she will provide notice to Defendant.
received from Atty Watson stating she is unable to appear today.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Kristyne Watson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Defendant stipulates to having the Hold Open Agreement in Count 1 revoked.  Court orders judgment entered upon def.'s plea of guilty on 10/20/15.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 4/21/16 at 10:30.  Bond continued.
As an ATR as a condition of probation - 120 days KCJ - 36 days served.
to Revoke Stipulated Hold Open Agreement (Count 1)  filed by ADA Thomas Binger

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Kristyne Watson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Counts 2 and 3 - Def. has violated conditions of probation.  Parties stipulate to 120 days in Co. Jail as an alternative to revocation, which will allow def. time to complete the Living Free program.  Court orders 120 days in Co. Jail as a condition of probation on each count, concurrent, with credit for 36 days served.
Count 1 - State filed a motion to revoke the hold open agreement.  Hearing on motion 2/17/16 at 9:30.  Bond continued.
Probation review hearing at 01-06-2016 01:30 pm
from probation agent Jennifer Merlin requestiing a court review hearing.
Court has reviewed letter received from Philip Tabili Sr. and takes no action; DE's father has no standing to file a bond motion (to modify).
received from Philip Tabili Sr.
Cts 2 & 3
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Stipulated Hold Open Agreement

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Philip L. Tabili, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Alicen Watson.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and case is resolved.  
Count 1- DE pleads Guilty; judgment is withheld and parties enter into a Stipulated Hold Open Agreement for 24 months.
Counts 2 & 3 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentence is withheld on both counts and DE is placed on probation for 2 years concurrent to each other with conditions.  Credit for 6 days if revoked.    DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court costs & surcharge to be paid during probation and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Jerril G. or his residence.  Oral motion to modify DE's bond to a signature bond at this time is denied by the court.  Appeal Rights given and BOND CONTINUES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.
received from Philip Tabili

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Philip L. Tabili, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
Atty Watson states DE is not eligible for drug court and requests an adjournment to discuss a further resolution; no objection by the State.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 09:40 am.
Scheduling Order

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Kristyne Watson. Clerk LE.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 9-9-15 @ 8:40am. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing
